title: Functional ND-Arrays
narrative:
ND-Arrays expose a powerful API for performing operations on them
    in a functional style.

features.id: We can initialize an ND-Array using a filler lambda mapping indices to items.

blocks.text: We instantiate the ND-Array using an initializer lambda which explains the indices of each item.
code: var t = Nda.of(String).withShape(2, 3).andWhere(( int i, int[] indices ) -> { i + ':' + indices.toString() })

blocks.text: The ND-Array will have the expected items:
We can also recognise them when printed as string:

features.id: We can find both min and max items in an ND-array by providing a comparator.

blocks.text: We create an ND-array of strings for which we want to find a min and max value:
We find the min value by passing a comparator (which takes 2 values and returns an int):
code: var min = n.minItem( ( String a, String b ) -> a.compareTo( b ) )

blocks.text: The resulting min value is the last item in the array:
We now try to find the max value:
code: var max = n.maxItem( ( String a, String b ) -> a.compareTo( b ) )

blocks.text: The max value is the last item in the array:

features.id: We can analyse the values of a nd-array using various predicate receiving methods

blocks.text: We create 2 tensors, where one is a slice of the other.
We can also easily turn a tensor into a stream!

features.id: We can use the "filter" method as a shortcut for "stream().filter(..)".

blocks.text: We create a tensor...
The filter method returns a filtered stream which we can collect!

features.id: We can use the "flatMap" method as a shortcut for "stream().flatMap(..)".

blocks.text: We create a nd-array...
We can use the "flatMap" method as a shortcut for "stream().flatMap(..)"

features.id: ND-Array mapping lambdas produce expected nd-arrays.

blocks.text: Instantiating a nd-array using an initializer lambda...
code: .andWhere(( int i, int[] indices ) -> { (i - 2) as Double })

blocks.text: The nd-array has been initialized with the expected values:
We want to perform an element wise mapping to a new nd-array...
We expect the returned nd-array to be a String container whose Strings are formatted according to our mapping lambda.
The original nd-array should not have changed because no inline operation occurred.

features.id: The "map" method is a shorter convenience method for mapping to the same type.

blocks.text: We create a nd-array with a single element.
We map the nd-array to a new nd-array of the same type.
The new nd-array should have the same value as the original nd-array.
The original nd-array should not have changed because no inline operation occurred.

features.id: We can find both min and max items in a tensor by providing a comparator.

blocks.text: We create a tensor of chars for which we want to find a min and max values:
code: .andWhere(( int i, int[] indices ) -> { (i+65) as char } )

blocks.text: We find the min value by passing a comparator (which takes 2 values and returns an int):
code: var min = t.minItem( ( Character a, Character b ) -> a.compareTo( b ) )

blocks.text: The resulting min value is the last item in the tensor, the letter A:
We now try to find the max value:
code: var max = t.maxItem( ( Character a, Character b ) -> a.compareTo( b ) )

blocks.text: The max value is the last item in the tensor, the letter Z:

features.id: We can collect a stream into a nd-array.

blocks.text: We create a stream of integers.
We collect the stream into a nd-array.
The resulting nd-array should have the same values as the stream.
